questions.question_text:
A developer wants to create an attended process which uses UI Automation activities on hidden or minimized windows. While the process is running on the user's machine, the user also needs the ability to use the machine to look up items in a desktop application.
Which activity is configured by default to enable interaction with hidden or minimized windows?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Select item works in background by default

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A. Select item works in background by default

Selected Answer: A
Select item:

NOTE: This activity uses the SimulateClick property by default and can not be changed, which means disabled elements are altered by default. Change the value of AlterIfDisabled to false for no interaction with disabled elements.

Selected Answer: A
The answer here is A. It's by default that Select item works in background.

Selected Answer: C
The given answer is correct

questions.question_text:
A developer has two collections containing data:
1. A list of strings called listA that was initialized with 2 items
2. An array of strings called arrayB that was initialized with 2 items
How can both collections be combined into a single 4-item collection called results?

choices.B: Use the String.Join method with listA and arrayB as parameters
choices.C: Use a Multiple Assign activity to add each item from arrayB to listA
choices.A: Use the Add To Collection activity with arrayB as the parameter
choices.D: Use a For Each activity to iterate through listA and add each item to arrayB

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Why Not the Other Options?
A. Use the Add To Collection activity with arrayB as the parameter:

The Add To Collection activity adds a single item to a collection. It cannot add an entire array at once.
B. Use the String.Join method with listA and arrayB as parameters:

The String.Join method concatenates strings into a single string, separated by a delimiter. It does not combine collections.
D. Use a For Each activity to iterate through listA and add each item to arrayB:

Arrays are static and cannot expand dynamically. This would not work without creating a new array.

Selected Answer: C
The given ans. is right

Selected Answer: B
Tested in Studio !
